content: I would agree whole-heartedly with you, sir. I am myself a lifelong and passionate Bradbury fan, having read all of his books multiple times. This may be in part because autumn is, as we all know, the best time of year, and Bradbury is, as we all know, the best author to read at this time of year. “Something Wicked This Way Comes” and “The October Country,” along with “The Halloween Tree” are, as we all know, the best works to read aloud to immerse yourself psychicly in the season. If, additionally, you listen to Ahmad Jamal’s rendering of “Autumn in New York” while reading these texts aloud, there is a chance of overdosing on the season, which isn’t recommended for first-timers. Best to build a tolerance before going for the extreme.
